text:
Hello All,
I am new to serverless-functions. I just created a function and I am trying to access it from my landing page template. It works well when I deploy the page. However, it gives a CORS issue when I try to preview the template.
"Access to fetch at '<my api>' from origin '<https://preview.hs-sites.com>' has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque response serves your needs, set the request's mode to 'no-cors' to fetch the resource with CORS disabled."

Any idea how can I get this running in preview mode?

Hey there. Unfortunately this is a known issue that weâ€™re working to resolve. I suggest testing using either a staged version of your page, password protected copy of your page, or testing in your developer sandbox account instead.

Apologize for the inconvenience.
In this case how are you referencing the function URL?
Thank you for your response. <@U6GNQ7JBU> I am using fetch.
As a temprorary workaround, you could do `/_hcms/api/<path>?portalId=<portalId>`
Is the request made in a separate JS file or in a script tag on the page?
